env.label: SKIP_ARCHIVED_LOGS
env.name: SKIP_ARCHIVED_LOGS
env.description: Defaults to false. Set to true to skip archived logs, i.e. proxy-host*.gz

env.label: BASIC_AUTH
env.name: BASIC_AUTH
env.description: Defaults to false. Set to true to enable nginx basic authentication. Docker container needs to stopped or restarted each time this flag is modified. This allows for the .htpasswd file to be changed accordingly.

env.label: BASIC_AUTH_USERNAME Ignore if Basic Auth set to false
env.name: BASIC_AUTH_USERNAME
env.description: (Optional) Requires BASIC_AUTH to bet set to true. Username for basic authentication.

env.label: BASIC_AUTH_PASSWORD Ignore if Basic Auth set to false
env.name: BASIC_AUTH_PASSWORD
env.description: (Optional) Requires BASIC_AUTH to bet set to true. Password for basic authentication.

templates.description:
This container sets up an Nginx webserver and reverse proxy with php support and a built-in letsencrypt client that automates free SSL server certificate generation and renewal processes. It also contains fail2ban for intrusion prevention.
  
  Before running this container, make sure that the url and subdomains are properly forwarded to this container's host.
  
  - Port 443 on the internet side of the router should be forwarded to this container's port 443.
  - If you need a dynamic dns provider, you can use the free provider duckdns.org where the url will be yoursubdomain.duckdns.org and the subdomains    can be www,ftp,cloud
  - The container detects changes to url and subdomains, revokes existing certs and generates new ones during start. 
  - It also detects changes to the DHLEVEL parameter and replaces the dhparams file.
  
  - If you'd like to password protect your sites, you can use htpasswd. Run the following command on your host to generate the htpasswd file docker exec -it swag htpasswd -c /config/nginx/.htpasswd <username>
templates.name: swag
templates.title: SWAG - Secure Web Application Gateway
templates.note:
Template created by Pi-Hosted Series
Check our Github page: https://github.com/pi-hosted/pi-hosted

Official Webpage: https://github.com/linuxserver/docker-swag

templates.description: With watchtower you can update the running version of your containerized app simply by pushing a new image to the Docker Hub or your own image registry.
